intro: Sabulina mesogitana subsp. mesogitana, commonly known as the Mesopotamian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Middle East. It features small, fleshy, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique species within the Montiaceae family.
